author: Sam Sacks
title: Fiction Chronicle: Vengeance Is Theirs
text:
When the girl called Ada was born, Akwaeke Emezi says in her novel, “Freshwater” (Grove, 229 pages, $24), a glitch in the cosmic machinery caused the gates dividing the spirit realm from the mortal world to stay open, and demigods flooded into the child’s body and were stuck there. These were the ogbanje, snake-shaped agents of the great Igbo deity Ala, and their influence was far from a benison. “Ogbanje are entitled to their vengeances; it is their nature, they are malicious spirits.”
So begins this witchy, electrifying...
